They were still quite connected, maybe not Pangea, but still there were par=
ts that were connected, there was a North America inland sea, India was an =
island, Australia was part of Antarctica, which could be reached but raft w=
ithout much travel from Africa. Just a few examples.
  ----- Original Messa=
ge ----- 
  From: CYBERWOLF4 
  To: nbwrpg@egroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, Oct=
ober 29, 2000 11:17 AM
  Subject: Re: OOC


  the continents would have alr=
eady split, Pangea was around with the dinosayrs, not the early humans.
   =
 ----- Original Message ----- 
    From: David Torrey 
    To: nbwrpg@egrou=
ps.com 
    Sent: Sunday, October 29, 2000 9:28 AM
    Subject: Re: OOC


 =
   I've taken that into consideration. I don't know if the others have, cau=
se my valley Nod doesn't exist in our time, the mountain where the Destron =
base is probably gone.
      ----- Original Message ----- 
      From: Rudr=
a656@... 
      To: nbwrpg@egroups.com 
      Sent: Sunday, October 29,=
 2000 6:10 AM
      Subject: OOC


      Something just occurred to me.  If=
 this is set at the approximate time of 
      early humans, then there wer=
en't any continents as we know them and are 
      talking about them.




=
        eGroups Sponsor
